introduction.p: In this activity we introduce the math symbol \Delta that represents change and we develop the concept of average rate of change.
It will be helpful to remember that the speed of an object is defined as the distance the object travels divided by the time it takes to travel that distance.
The prerequisites for this lesson are knowing how to calculate the slope of a line and understanding the meaning of slope.

subsection.title: Computing Average Rate of Change
subsection.p: As we move from one point to another point on a function, there are two changes that take place. The input will change, call it \Delta\text{Input} and the output will change, call it \Delta\text{Output}.
If we divide the two changes we get an average rate of change.
An average rate of change =\frac{\Delta Output}{\Delta Input}.
Does this look familiar? Think rise over run. Once again, average rate of change is just slope.

subsection.p: As demonstrated in the previous exercise, the average rate of change of a function depends on what interval (section) of the input axis we use.
As a practical example, consider the hourly salary for a worker at a manufacturing plant who works during the day versus someone who works at night.

If the day worker works from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. and earns \$168 then over a span of 8 hours the worker has earned an average rate of \frac{168}{8} = 21 \frac{\$}{\text{hour}}. But this is on the interval 8 a.m. \leq time \leq 4 p.m.

However, if the night worker works the same number of hours from 4 p.m. \leq time \leq 12 a.m. (from 4 p.m. to 12 a.m.) and earns \$200, then over an 8 hour span that worker has earned an average rate of \frac{200}{8} = 25 \frac{\$}{\text{hour}}.

We see that the average rate is greater during a night interval of time versus a day interval because night workers get paid more at this plant. In each case the average rate of pay, or just average rate, is the total change in money earned (\Delta\text{output}) divided the total change in hours worked (\Delta\text{input}).
To find an average rate of change, two outputs need to be calculated and the results are subtracted. Then that value is divided by the differce between the two input values.
